item.title: C Compatibility Headers
G++ And Clang++
item.description: What Is This About? A common mistake is not running the right command when compiling a C++ program. So Which Command Do I Use? If you are using GCC then use the g++ command g++ main.cpp -o main If you are using Clang then use the clang++ command clang++ main.cpp -o main Why Is This A Thing? The GNU Compiler Collection is known as GCC. Confusingly this collection of compilers also includes a program named gcc, however this is not what you want.

item.title: Getline And Cin
item.description: Does Noob A Bamboozle Using getline() together with cin >> is a sharp corner. This guide will help you figure that out. The Problem When you use >> to get input from a stream, then the stream does not consume whitespace after your input. This means for example that if you cin >> up to the end of the line, then the subsequent newline \n character will still remain in the stream.

item.title: How Binary Works
item.description: Binary Numbers How do they work!? What Is A Number System What Is A Base The base of your number system is how many digits you have. We doggos use a beef hotdog number system. No, wait… we use a base ten number system. What does that actually mean though? I’m The Only Tigger We have been using base ten for so long in our normal lives, like at the grocery store or when talking about footbal scores, that it just feels natural and normal to most people.

item.title: What Is A Data Type
item.description: Before You Begin See: How Binary Works Computer Memory Computers store information in memory as binary numbers. Transistors Transistors are good at turning on and off. This can easily be used represent a one or a zero. The information in your computer is managed by a bunch of transitors. You can think of it like being one bit per transistor, meaning each transistor can represent either a zero or a one.

item.title: Which C++ Book?
item.description: What Should I Choose? These are pretty good, though I haven’t read them all, some may be better or worse. Some may be better for your skill level than others. You agree to not hold me liable if any of these books eats your first born child, kicks your puppy or is otherwise nasty to you. I’m Literally Broke LearnCPP CppLang Tutorial I Want Something Easy And Fun For Children MIT Scratch FREE Roblox Studio I’m Scared Of C++ Code Academy - Learn Python FREE I Am A Beginner Programming: Principles and Practice Using C++ I Have Programming Experience A Tour of C++ Murach’s C++ Programming Professional C++ I Want To Know More Scott Meyers C++ Concurrency In Action High Performance C++ I Am Extremely Motivated And I Like Pain The C++ Programming Language I Actually Just Want To Play Video Games Ok, sure, try one of these.
